    • Method Detail

      • mandelbrotImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage mandelbrotImage​(int width,
                                                           int height,
                                                           double xMin,
                                                           double xMax,
                                                           double yMin,
                                                           double yMax,
                                                           int maxIterations)
        Generates the Mandelbrot Set Image given parameters
        Parameters:
        width - The output image width in pixels
        height - The output image height in pixels
        xMin - The minimum value of the domain of real numbers
        xMax - The maximum value of the domain of real numbers
        yMin - The minimum value of the domain of complex numbers
        yMax - The maximum value of the domain of complex numbers
        maxIterations - The maximum number of iterations to determine the divergence or convergence of a point
        Returns:
        An Image with the Mandelbrot Set
        See Also:
        BufferedImage

      • mandelbrotColor

        public static int mandelbrotColor​(ComplexNumber c,
                                  int maxIterations,
                                  double divergenceRadius)
        Determines the color of a point based upon the divergence or convergence of the point
        Parameters:
        c - The ComplexNumber point to evaluate
        maxIterations - The maximum number of iterations to determine the divergence or convergence of the point
        divergenceRadius - A radius to stop evaluations outside of for easier computations

      • map

        public static double map​(double val,
                         double min,
                         double max,
                         double newMin,
                         double newMax)
        Linear interpolation of double values
        Parameters:
        val - The input value to interpolate
        min - The minimum value of the input range
        max - The maximum value of the input range
        newMin - The minimum value of the output range
        newMax - The maximum value of the output range
        Returns:
        The double value interpolated from the input range to the output range
